business.headline: India-UK free trade deal: How the deal could boost bilateral tradeThe deal is expected to provide greater market access for Indian products and services, while UK companies, particularly in sectors like automobiles and medical equipment, will also benefit from reduced tariffs.

Why some purchases are priceless: Startup founder on spending and living wellWe often treat money decisions like maths problems, but this startup founder says some buys, like a family car or your own home, bring wealth you can't count.

PM Modi in UK for FTA: Cheaper scotch and cars on cardsPrime Minister Narendra Modi is in the UK for a meeting with the UK Prime Minister and is also expected to meet King Charles III, with the India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) being the main focus. This agreement is set to provide significant market access to Indian sectors like fisheries, textiles, gems, jewellery, and leather, with a potential market size of $5.2 billion in the UK for the fisheries sector alone.

Money matters, but joy matters more: Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta's mantra for lifeMany young earners feel constant pressure to save every rupee for the future. It's common to hear advice about building a fat retirement fund or aiming for the highest returns. But Radhika Gupta wants people to know that money is only useful if it also makes your present better.

Whisky, chocolates, cars: What gets cheaper for Indians after UK trade dealThe trade agreement was signed by India's Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and the UK's Secretary of State for Business and Trade, Jonathan Reynolds.

Sensex ends 542 points lower, Nifty below 25,100 as volatility weighs heavyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 542.47 points lower at 82,184.17, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 157.80 points to close at 25,062.10. Selling pressure was visible across sectors, with FMCG, IT, and financial stocks dragging the indices down.

Small shopkeepers are turning away from UPI paymentsAccording to the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), UPI saw over 14.04 billion transactions in June 2024. Yet, for many at the grassroots, the system seems too complex and risky to fully embrace.
ED raids hit Anil Ambani stocks: Reliance Power, Infra sink 5%Reliance Infrastructure has lost 9.37% in the past five trading sessions, Reliance Power has fallen by 7.41% during the same period.

Filed the wrong ITR form? Here's how to fix it to avoid penaltyMany taxpayers only spot mistakes after hitting 'Submit'. Filing the wrong form can snowball into bigger headaches later, from refund delays to unexpected penalties. But tax experts say you do have ways to set things right, provided you act quickly.

Sensex plunges 600 points. Why is the stock market down today?The S&P BSE Sensex dropped 592.85 points to 82,133.79 by 1:04 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 169.25 points to 25,050.65. All broader market indices were in the red as market sentiment weakened.

EPFO now on DigiLocker: See how it helps youThe government has been making several digital changes for EPFO members in the last few months. This new feature on DigiLocker is another step to make your provident fund details more accessible.

Loan, lies and bribery? Why Anil Ambani is facing ED heatMultiple agencies, including the National Housing Bank, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi), the National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA), and Bank of Baroda shared findings and inputs that contributed to the investigation.

entertainment.headline: Blackpink's Lisa debuts on Netflix's Hitmakers, rejects rough tracksAfter much excitement, Lisa makes her Netflix debut on 'Hitmakers'. Twelve producers present original songs to her, but only one track wins her approval.

Shaan Grover on 'Mahesh Dalle' memes after Saiyaara: Was initially disturbedActor Shaan Grover, in an exclusive conversation with IndiaToday.in, spoke about the criticism he received for his role in 'Saiyaara'. The film stars Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda in the lead.

Singer Babla Mehta, known as Voice of Mukesh, dies in MumbaiSinger Babla Mehta, known as the Voice of Mukesh, died on July 22 in Mumbai. He also sang alongside legendary singer Late Lata Mangeskar in the film 'Chandni'.

As Masaan turns 10, Shweta Tripathi discusses why it's relevance will never fadeShweta Tripathi, in an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, spoke about her debut film 'Masaan' as it completed a decade today. The actor opened up about the timeless social relevance of the Neeraj Ghaywan-directorial, and how the movie continues to hold a special place in her heart.

The Summer I Turned Pretty just got ringed and entered its villain eraThe latest episode of The Summer I Turned Pretty is here and everybody is talking about it. Jeremiah proposes to Belly and everything turns into chaos, here's why.

Fauda 5 trailer: After Hamas attack, Doron faces new threats and inner demonsThe trailer for the Israeli show 'Fauda' Season 5 is finally out. The new season will showcase a storyline two years after the Hamas-led attack on Israel on October 7, 2023, and the outbreak of the Swords of Iron war.

Saiyaara: 7 questions we want to ask Mohit Suri after watching Ahaan-Aneet's film'Saiyaara' has struck a chord with audiences, earning Rs 150 crore at the box office. However, the film faces criticism for its lack of originality and unrealistic portrayal of Alzheimer's disease.

10 years of Masaan, film that gave a brilliantly restrained actor like Vicky KaushalActor Vicky Kaushal's 'Masaan' marked ten years on July 24, 2025. The film has received immense praise for its performances and grounded storytelling. IndiaToday.in shares insights on how the film elevated Vicky Kaushal's brilliance as a restrained actor.

Vicky Kaushal celebrates 10 years of Masaan: So much to learn, to growVicky Kaushal clocked 10 years of his iconic debut film 'Masaan' on Thursday. As the film turned a decade old, the actor reflected on his growth and learnings.

Mohit Suri honours Sandeep Vanga's fire and fearlessness as Saiyaara stirs heartsAs 'Saiyaara' soars to success, director Mohit Suri dedicates a special note to fellow filmmaker Sandeep Reddy Vanga for supporting his film publicly even before its release.

Nushrratt Bharuccha on sexism in Bollywood: Hero's vanity van nicer than mineActor Nushrratt Bharuccha recalled instances of sexism and inequality in Bollywood. She stated in a recent interview that there have been times when she sought permission to use the hero's vanity van because they are nicer than hers.

Vetri Maaran's Bad Girl teaser removed from YouTube over minor portrayal problemThe Madras High Court has ordered the removal of the 'Bad Girl' film teaser from social media due to concerns of inappropriate portrayal of minors, classifying it as child pornography.

Did Ahaan Panday-Tara Sutaria date each other? Their old pic sparks buzzAhaan Panday's debut in Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' has drawn attention, but a resurfaced teenage photo with Tara Sutaria has sparked fresh rumours of a past romance.

Selena Gomez's Only Murders 5 release date announced: When and where to watchSinger-actor Selena Gomez's 'Only Murders In The Building' is all set for the release of its 5th season. Here's everything about the release.

Maareesan review: Fahadh-Vadivelu's road trip takes wrong turn post-intervalRelease Date:Fri Jul 25, 2025Maareesan movie review: Director Sudheesh Sankar's 'Maareesan', starring Vadivelu and Fahadh Faasil, is a comedy thriller. While the film wows you with a brilliant first half, it takes a formulaic turn in the second half.

Huma Qureshi's Bayaan to premiere at TIFF 2025 as only Indian filmActor Huma Qureshi's film 'Bayaan' will have its world premiere at TIFF 2025. The film directed by Bikas Ranjan Mishra has been selected for the prestigious global festival's Discovery section.

DJ Snake returns to India with a six-city tour: I've missed your energyDJ Snake is set to return to India with a six-city tour in September. He will kick off his tour in Kolkata on September 26 and wrap it up in Delhi-NCR on October 5.

No retakes, no scripts: The Traitors India director on filming show real-time'The Traitors India' director Nishant Nayak shared insights on directing the reality TV show with no retakes and live filming. In an interview with India Today, he highlighted how authenticity and Indian sensibilities shaped the unique adaptation.

WWE great Hulk Hogan dies at 71 due to cardiac arrestLegendary American wrestler Hulk Hogan died due to cardiac arrest, aged 71, on Thursday, WWE confirmed on Thursday. Hogan helped World Wrestling Entertainment catapult into mainstream popularity in the 1980s.

Ancient Hindu temple with Shivling and the Thailand-Cambodia warAncient Hindu temples are part of the area, the dispute over which has sparked a war between Thailand and Cambodia. The clashes began after Cambodian drones were reportedly spotted near the Ta Muen Temple Complex, a group of 11th-century Khmer Hindu temples dedicated to Lord Shiva. This is all about the 1,000-year-old Prasat Ta Muen Thom temple and how it turned into a Buddhist centre.
PM Modi meets King Charles at Sandringham House, gifts him tree saplingPM Modi met King Charles III at Sandringham House the United Kingdom after India and UK signed the free trade deal.

Rights group gives Muslim slant to India's fight against illegal immigrantsHuman Rights Watch (HRW) has accused India of "unlawfully expelling hundreds of Muslims" to Bangladesh. The report also claims some of them are Indian nationals. The HRW report gives a communal slant to a sovereign nation's action against illegal immigrants settled in its territory, who are a drain on resources and also a security risk.

Baby born mid-air on Air India Express Muscat-Mumbai flight, crew assists deliveryWhen a Thai national went into labour, the crew swiftly ensured a secure environment for the birth. The cabin crew, trained for such emergencies, rose to the occasion and assisted with the delivery, receiving timely help from a nurse who was also on board.

India to tour England again in 2026 for white-ball series, schedule announcedIndia will tour England in July 2026 for an eight-match white-ball series including five T20Is and three ODIs. Parthiv Patel weighsENG vs IND: Speaking to Rishabh Pant's toe injury, Parthiv Patel said that he's okay with the ICC's rule of like-for-like replacement of wicketkeepers where the incoming player won't be allowed to bat and will only be allowed to keep wickets.

Rishabh Pant suffers right toe fracture, likely out of England seriesRishabh Pant is unlikely to take any further part in the Manchester Test and is expected to miss the remainder of the ongoing Test series against England after scans revealed a fracture in his right toe.

Zahaan Hemrajani secures historic top 10 finish at U17 sailing worldsMumbai's Zahaan Hemrajani secured a top 10 overall finish at the prestigious U17 O'pen Skiff World Championships, held from July 17 to 23 in Nishinomiya, Japan. His result marks one of the highest-ever finishes by an Indian sailor at this global youth event.

China Open: Satwik-Chirag reach quarterfinals, HS Prannoy crashes outSatwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty advanced to the quarterfinals of the China Open with a commanding win over Indonesia's top doubles pair. However, India's singles campaign came to an end as HS Prannoy bowed out after a hard-fought three-game loss.

Ravindra Jadeja aims for Gary Sobers' historic Test double in EnglandENG vs IND: Ravindra Jadeja is on the cusp of reaching the unique double of 1000 runs and 30 wickets in Tests on English soil. Gary Sobers is the only visiting cricketer to have achieved the feat.

Dinesh Karthik questions India's call to send Shardul ahead of SundarFormer India batter Dinesh Karthik has questioned the Indian team management to promote Shardul Thakur ahead of Washington Sundar after Rishabh Pant retired hurt in the fourth Test against England.

Sai Sudharsan impresses: How shadow batting helped India's new No.3ENG vs IND, 4th Test: Sai Sudharsan said that shadow batting helped him get mentally prepared for the ongoing Manchester Test, where he notched his maiden Test fifty.

Rishabh Pant's injury is quite serious, could be series-ending: Michael AthertonEngland vs India: Former England captain Michael Atherton has voiced grave concern over wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant's injury, warning it could rule him out of the remainder of the series-a potential body blow for India.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
